abstract.p: AT&T Corp and Ericsson are co-sponsoring interactive wireless promotion tied to ABC program Who Wants to Be a Millionaire; two companies will mail out 100,000 electronic devices shaped like Ericsson cellular telephones to consumers, who will be asked to watch show in late October for special encoded commercials; when pointed at TV screen, devices can read light patterns, telling viewers whether they have won prizes (S)

block.p: In another experiment by advertisers using new technology to deliver sales pitches, AT&T and Ericsson are co-sponsoring an interactive wireless promotion tied to the ABC quiz show ''Who Wants to Be a Millionaire.'' AT&T and Ericsson will mail out 100,000 electronic devices shaped like Ericsson cellular phones to consumers, who will be asked to watch the show in late October for special encoded commercials. When pointed at a TV screen, the devices can read light patterns, telling viewers whether they have won prizes.
